creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: busy pedestrian street in evening; three large lanterns, red and white, with black Japanese text; other signs and lights; shops with curtains over doorways; figures walking including woman in red kimono with a pink bundle with child, both seen from back, in LLQ, and young woman in purple kimono and green jacket in LRQ
marks: left, in maroon: 昭和十三年　夜の東京　新宿 {Shōwa jūsannen sa LLC, in black: 遠志 {Tōshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Shinjuku
